Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: from top, part of black lip; handle zone frieze in black-figure decoration, siren and sphinx; of siren, to left, tail feathers with added red and part of one wing remain; sphinx, walking to right, is complete with red on underbelly and rump; below, black wall.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 41, pl. XXI, no. 13)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 406, no. B610)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1375) (phase 3)
